com.mapzen.android.graphics

Class MapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.RelativeLayout
          • com.mapzen.android.graphics.MapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class MapView
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout
    Wrapper for Tangram MapView that initializes MapzenMap for client applications.

      • getMapAsync

        public void getMapAsync(OnMapReadyCallback callback)
        Load map asynchronously using APK key declared in XML resources. For example: <string name="mapzen_api_key">[YOUR_API_KEY]</string>
        Parameters:
        callback - listener to be invoked when map is initialized and ready to use.

      • getMapAsync

        public void getMapAsync(MapStyle mapStyle,
                        OnMapReadyCallback callback)
        Load map asynchronously using APK key declared in XML resources. For example: <string name="mapzen_api_key">[YOUR_API_KEY]</string>
        Parameters:
        mapStyle - mapStyle that should be set.
        callback - listener to be invoked when map is initialized and ready to use.

      • getMapAsync

        public void getMapAsync(MapStyle mapStyle,
                        java.util.Locale locale,
                        OnMapReadyCallback callback)
        Load map asynchronously using APK key declared in XML resources. For example: <string name="mapzen_api_key">[YOUR_API_KEY]</string>
        Parameters:
        mapStyle - mapStyle that should be set.
        locale - used to determine language that should be used for map labels.
        callback - listener to be invoked when map is initialized and ready to use.

        public void hideZoomOut()
        Hide button for zooming out.

      • getAttribution

        public android.widget.TextView getAttribution()
        Return the attribution text view.

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        You must call this method from the parent Activity/Fragment's corresponding method.
